Bustronome Paris.description: Aboard a double-decker bus converted into a restaurant, guests will enjoy a friendly welcome and a wide variety of dishes in a fashionable setting. The BUSTRONOME : a Parisian invitation to rediscover some of the City of Light's most beautiful locations while enjoying fine French cuisine. This singular journey combines a visual experience with a treat for the taste buds; Paris residents and tourists alike can indulge their love of culture while savouring good food.

Alleno Paris.description: On the first floor of the superb n√©o-classical mansion with many bay windows, Yannick All√©no has established his 3 MICHELIN star restaurant (2021 Michelin Guide), also ranked at The Worlds's 50 Best restaurants. Au Vieux Paris.description: Au Vieux Paris restaurant in the very heart of Paris, on the Ile de la Cite not two steps from Notre Dame, has history and gastronomy in its favour. Patrons Odette and Georges bring their seasonal ingredients each week from the finest organic farms in the Aveyron in southern France to create dishes like warm foie gras, duck breast a lÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩorange, and other classics. The restaurant is sited in an CanonÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩs residence constructed in 1512 and the dÔøΩÔøΩcor ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ brilliantly over the top ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ reflects history in every detail, the heavily figured scarlet wallpaper and tented ceilings, the antique prints, the exposed stonework and rich draperies. Au Vieux Paris is terribly romantic - youÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩll even have to stroll by the Seine to get home.

reviews.title: C√©sar is a vibe
reviews.review_text:
Great service, flavorful food and a beautiful ambience. The playlist was a whole vibe as well - very diverse and upbeat. I got the king crab and hubby got the black ravioli pasta - a first for him and for a picky eater he was impressed.
So I did well as we continue his birthday celebration.

reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.review_text: This restaurant was great! Our food was amazing I had the truffle ravioli! The service was great, the waiters were really friendly! The atmosphere was great too they had a DJ in the back. We loved the look of the place too.

reviews.title: I recommended this restaurant
reviews.review_text: Fresh food and friendly and beautiful staffs and also delicious pizza and amazing  pasta and clean restaurant and nice view

reviews.title: Awful
reviews.review_text:
We saw this restaurant over social media due to their visits by celebrities. When people say, don‚Äôt trust celebrities reviews, this is one of those situations.

The restaurant itself is quite nice and has a good vibe however the food was terrible. I got the cheese wheel pasta, it is simply plain pasta with melted cheese on. My friend had the bolognese which was just standard bolognese. 

If you‚Äôre British, I‚Äôve genuinely had better food at a hungry horse. Honestly, save your money and go to McDonald‚Äôs because it‚Äôs a lot better. 

This would be fine, if the bill didn‚Äôt come to ‚Ç¨103 for two pasta dishes and two drinks üòü

The customer service wasn‚Äôt anything out of the ordinary, wasn‚Äôt good, wasn‚Äôt bad either. 

Also, I suppose it doesn‚Äôt have anything to do with the restaurant itself, but a man attempted to mug me right outside of the restaurant and then walked into the restaurant to be served.

reviews.title: Delicious food
reviews.review_text: Love this place, a must go when in Paris. I‚Äôve tried the shrimp tempura and they were very good. Also had the king crab pasta and spicy rigatoni. Love eating here and would recommend making a reservation.

Paris Las Vegas.description: Experience everything you love about Paris, in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. The city of lights shine on the strip. Guest rooms at Paris Las Vegas Hotel & Casino have a distinctly chic European look, with Versailles-style fixtures and luxury romantic d√©cor. Red Rooms are sophisticated and modern while the splurge-worthy Louis XV Suite features chandeliers and oversized bathtubs.

reviews.title: 3 day stay!
reviews.review_text: We stayed 3 nights at Paris.  The casino was great and the restaurants were as well.  But the rooms have not been taken care of at all.  Probably will not stay again unless the rooms have been updated.  Very sad, this used to be the place to stay but not anymore.

reviews.title: Better than these reviews say
reviews.review_text: We enjoyed our stay at Paris last weekend. Yes the line to check in was very long, however there are multiple electronic stations where you can check in yourself and that line was short, so we checked in within a few minutes, even adding late checkin for ourselves with no issue. The beds were comfortable, the room was very clean, and the shower was probably the largest hotel shower I've ever seen. We had the prefix brunch at the Eiffel Tower restaurant; I highly recommend the creme brulee french toast, it was incredible. I would definitely stay at Paris again.

reviews.title: Worn down somewhat
reviews.review_text: I was there 2 or 3 years ago and was impressed....but, that was then...my latest trip was not as impressive. Hotel rooms have worn down somewhat. Peeling wallpaper, thread bare carpet patches, awful dingy hard towels an dirty bed linens. It could have been worse, my travel companions room had dirty underwear,  filthy tubs and pills on the floor, they changed rooms and it was just as dirty with difficulties getting housekeeping services. Expected better for the price...

reviews.title: Hotel was nice, but beds were so uncomfortable
reviews.review_text: The hotel was nice overall. The bathroom was clean with the exception of an old bar of soap with hair on it. The beds though were so uncomfortable. The sheets were also very rough and made our skin red. Overall I‚Äôd say 3/5 stars. Mostly because we didn‚Äôt get much sleep due to the bed situation

reviews.title: Cold Water Conference
reviews.review_text: Stayed with Paris Hotel numerous times for the annual SEMA show.  Usually with a Nice experience.  This visit however was 1st met with a Room and a Safe that would Not function.  Calling down to the main office, we than had a person visit and confirm, the Safe Inoperable.  Paris moved us to another room on the same floor and we settled in.  Only to realize the sink would not provide Warm to Hot water until it was running for 10-15 minutes straight.   This is huge with more than one person in the room, and a complete waste of water.   Oddly enough, the shower would warm up in a normal manner.  Secondly, the TV would lose internet connectivity so often that we would give up on watching TV in the early morning or evening.

Ritz Paris.description: Located on the iconic Place Vend√¥me, the Ritz Paris is one of the most legendary hotels in the City of Lights. Refinement of French art de vivre meets elegance of Belle √âpoque d√©cor. Exquisitely appointed 71 rooms and 71 suites bear the name of F. Scott Fitzgerald or Marcel Proust. Ritz Paris is a place where dreams come to life. The famous Bar Vend√¥me welcomes guests to savor dishes at any hour of the day while the Ritz Bar is the perfect place to enjoy zodiac-themed cocktails. Ritz Paris Le Comptoir celebrates modern conviviality and French gourmandise, with exceptional pastries by Chef Fran√ßois Perret. At the √âcole Ritz Escoffier, enthusiasts, from novice to professional, can perfect their approach to French cuisine and pastry-making. The Ritz Club & Spa and its sumptuous pool elevates well-being to an art form. Last but not least, Salon Proust is the place to enjoy a delightful teatime √† la fran√ßaise and no visit to the Ritz Paris would be complete without stopping by the iconic Bar Hemingway.

reviews.title: If a mistake is made, quick reparations are done.
reviews.review_text:
I attended the Escoffier class in the morning and was escorted to the room personally, a lovely touch. However, another woman's purse and luggage was located within. 

Prompt apologies were communicated and my luggage was delivered within 15 minutes or so. My fatigue was overwhelming so I declined the offer to unpack. 

Later, I looked in the Hemingway bar which intimate but doesn't open up for conversation with its limited seats at the bar. You need to bring your friends with you.

I moved to the Vendome bar with lovely piano tunes and had a lively conversation with an attorney from Finland and later, a couple from Australia. Ambiance and environment were super.

reviews.title: Perfect in every way!
reviews.review_text:
This was my first stay at the Ritz, but it won‚Äôt be my last. Every staff member that I encountered was professional but friendly and made me feel quite welcomed. 

One of the great perks of a stay at the Ritz is that your room is ready when you arrive, regardless of the time (as long as you let them know your arrival time in advance).  Many flights from the US arrive quite early in the morning, so this was a huge plus for me. It is also possible to delay check out until 3 pm on your day of departure. 

I have already booked a second stay for January 2025

reviews.title: Beautiful place but food only average
reviews.review_text: Had lunch in the Ritz on Monday after Arc weekend.. Nice table in garden room.. very good Regnard wine.. we ordered 2 Croque Monsieur and  a chicken Caesar Salad.. the service was very good.. polite, friendly and professional... the food was a let down, unfortunately.. it was well presented and in a timely fashion.. but the salad was lacking in taste and flavour.. the Croque was described as average by those who ate it.. cocktails after lunch were lovely... it was a pity about the food.. fabulous place though.. our wine waiter, Axel, was the epitome of French charm at it's best..

reviews.title: Chapter and Verse of Comfort
reviews.review_text: As a bookworm, I was in heaven. Each floor was themed after a different literary genre, with quotes adorning the walls and books available to borrow everywhere. The cozy reading nooks scattered throughout were perfect for losing oneself in a story. The staff, well-versed in literature, were always ready with a recommendation. It was a bibliophile's dream come true!

reviews.title: Epitome of parisian luxury
reviews.review_text:
This hotel is truly in a league of its own. The concierge service deserves special mention - their knowledge and efficiency were outstanding. They anticipated our needs and made excellent recommendations that enhanced our Paris experience.
the attention to detail throughout the hotel is remarkable. from the exquisitely appointed rooms to the flawless service in every interaction, the ritz maintains its reputation as an icon of luxury hospitality.
While the stay was short, the memories will last a lifetime. for those seeking the pinnacle of parisian luxury, the ritz paris delivers an unforgettable experience that justifies its legendary status. truly a 5-star gem in every sense.

reviews.title: Hello Paris!
reviews.review_text: Great location, friendly service excellent housekeeping, overall a great experience! Definitely the best hotel in town.

reviews.title: Hotel Heaven
reviews.review_text: Once again another fabulous stay at Le Bristol! If heaven has a hotel this would be it. Every detail in the room from the bed to the towels is perfect. The concierge team is outstanding , they took care of all of our dining and tours. The staff is so friendly and sincere can't wait to return again.

reviews.title: Still the One
reviews.review_text: We have stayed at this luxury hotel multiple times over the years. With each returning visit, there are pleasant surprises, as the team is always exploring new ways to enhance the space, the brand and the experience. What doesn't change is the culture of top drawer hospitality and extraordinary service that is consistent in everything they do and everywhere you turn. Old school excellence, elegance and warmth at its best. We look forward to returning next year...if we can wait that long.

reviews.title: Exceptional in every way!
reviews.review_text: Just about perfect in every way, true grande dame boutique hotel. Gorgeous on inside and outside, beautiful lobby and rooms, 3 star Michelin restaurant, phenomenal food, service and attentiveness. Pretty much our favorite hotel in the world!  Yes, it's very expensive but perfection is not cheap!

reviews.title: Delightful Discovery
reviews.review_text: This place is a breath of fresh air in a world of cookie-cutter experiences. The attention to detail is remarkable, from the thoughtful layout to the personalized service. Every aspect seems designed to delight and surprise. The staff's genuine enthusiasm is contagious, making e

reviews.title: We can‚Äôt sleep because of bad services.
reviews.review_text: Aircon is not working.  Telephone is not working. We spend two (2) nights without sleep because of a very hot room. We reported the issue on the receptionist twice.  They just promised to fix it never done anything. Me and my wife are very frustrated.  We don‚Äôt recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel, very  professional personal, very well placed, nearby everything, I‚Äôll come back for sure!!!
reviews.review_text: Excellent, specially personal of the Hotel, particularly Paulo such a nice man, continuously worry about any need that we have, he helped us in many ways. Hope in my next visit all the amenities are set, like restaurant, the entrance, breakfast used to be better when I visited it in 2022, best regards to all the personal they‚Äôre the best!

reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Paris
reviews.review_text: My favorite hotel in the heart of my favorite district of Paris! Convenient location (close to train, shopping, restaurants) yet quiet and charming. Breakfast was lovely, well stocked in-room coffee/tea, friendly staff, very clean hotel that is well maintained (elevators fast!)

reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff but currently baorded up as being renovated.
reviews.review_text: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a month long trip. Great location and as per other reviews the staff are very friendly and helpful. However, we were unaware that the hotel is currently being renovated. The front is all boarded up and the outdoor courtyard is not available. As a result there is no natural light coming into the hotel. When we arrived security had to come out and get us as they obviously saw we could not find the entrance. We didn't enjoy our stay as it felt dark and pokey.

reviews.title: Very nice experience in paris
reviews.review_text: Paulo one of the best employees of the Novotel hotel, very servicial and kind. He help us too much in our time in paris. He told and explain many things to do in paris and places to know, he recommend many restaurants and was very good. He help us to do our visit was very easy.

reviews.title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
reviews.review_text:
SO many things wrong with this hostel. First, the staff were all so unfriendly, condescending, aggressive and SO rude. Secondly, the rooms were MANKY. There were stains ALL OVER our sheets, gum on the bed frames, nails on the floor and hair all under the pillows. The bathrooms were full of mold and again hair. The rooms were SO hot and humid ALL THE TIME and the AC wouldn‚Äôt work and the windows won‚Äôt open fully. 
Thirdly, the beds were incredibly uncomfortable and the pillows didn‚Äôt support our necks at all - we all woke up with sore necks and backs the next morning with barely any sleep. 
Fourthly, everything was VERY overpriced- 3‚Ç¨ for 500ml of water?? MAD. And 7.50‚Ç¨ to rent a towel?? HELLO??? 
I could name incidents that occurred when I stayed but I feel I could get into trouble if I mention them. But AVOID THIS HOSTEL AT ALL COST!!

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.review_text: We organized a quick visit to Paris with friends with children in tow. We found a structure with welcoming staff, with the reception always open and available to answer requests. The stay met expectations, the rooms are functional and clean. No annoying noises. I recommend booking at Generator Paris

reviews.title: Single Woman - One Week in Mixed Dorm (6 Bed)
reviews.review_text:
Generally it's a fine place to stay if you need a place for a few nights - but what I didn't see in other reviews is that the bathrooms weren't terribly clean (tho the bedrooms were fine, cleanliness wise). And the price was pretty good but the location isn't so great. To be polite, it's not in a great area, so usually when I got up for the day I would immediately take the metro and head towards more central Paris to find a cafe or something. (Though the metro is extremely close so that was nice!) They do have luggage storage you can pay for, but it's easier to just keep it in your room (in my opinion). And I had 2 giant pieces of luggages which I was able to just put in the corner of the room and had no issues. (And then I put my backpack and whatnot in the storage under the bed.) 

The room was clean but just seemed like it wasn't super well maintained. I only say that because it seemed the window was broken and there was a temporary sign saying not to open it. (So the room would sometimes get a little stuffy/warm since we couldn't let any fresh air in.) And the hinges on my storage container under the bed were broken. Minor things of course, but worth mentioning. 

I had great experiences with the people I had in my room, they were all very friendly and I even spent a couple days walking around Paris with a couple of them! No issues at all with it being a mixed dorm. (I liked to refer to them as my "temporary friends" bc we would chat and hang out in Paris for a few days and then one of us would check out of the hostel and have to say goodbye lol.) 

And the staff were very lovely and helpful and are happy to help in English or French.

Overall I had a pleasant stay, but I just wanted to be honest about some of the negative points that I didn't see in other reviews before I booked.

reviews.title: Cost-aware Business Trip
reviews.review_text: Positive experience on a last-minute business trip...wish the architect and lighting designer had been less excited by the word generator and more excited about contributing to Paris.

reviews.title: Top place
reviews.review_text: Top place to party or just to take a drink!!!ü•≥ The staff is very nice and international and they made lots of partys where everyone is wellcome. You can meet people from all the worls, from studens to startupers businessman or globetroters!

The Peninsula Paris.description: Exquisitely restored spaces are complemented by contemporary art installations, furnishings and technology. Dazzling rooftop spaces and private terrace gardens offer 360¬∞ views and glamorous extras that make The Peninsula Paris a decidedly 21st century palace.As with all Peninsula Hotels, location is of prime importance and Paris is no exception. Just steps away from the Arc de Triomphe and Avenue des Champs Elys√©es at 19 Avenue Kl√©ber in the heart of the elegant 16th arrondissement, The Peninsula sits close to some of the world‚Äôs most famous monuments, museums and luxury shopping districts.

reviews.title: A wonderful break in Paris at a perfect hotel.
reviews.review_text:
We needed a break in Paris and chose the Peninsula with reliance on the high standards we have always had there. This trip met and exceeded the mark. The Peninsula is well stated elegance and cool and calm and serene with just enough edge of excitement.  The rooms are very nice and well supported by the technology that is part of their now standard array (we were at the new Peninsula in Istanbul in August and will provide a separate review). We were met at the door by Rana Martin form guest services and escorted to our room. The suite was nice and well appointed and very comfortable. A lovely selection of fruit and macrons awaited us and the flowers and appointments in the room were lovely and very proper and home. Rana is a gem in all respects.

The hallmark of The Peninsula has become its persons. Everyone greets you with a welcoming smile and treats you as an honored guest. The entire Concierge staff assisted with our flowers for our room and our challenging requests for restaurant reservations. This was handled by the entire team including Jeremie and C√©lia and Clotilde and Christophe (the entire very large and capable team is always happy and eager to be of assistance!). Pro traveler tip: get the WhatsApp contact to the Concierge Team and make your asks in real time and enjoy immediate and professional support before and during your stay. The service levels they provide are exactly why one stays at The Peninsula as they do everything with a smile and sense of pride that enhances the experience.

We caught up on much needed sleep at the hotel during our stay. It has been a long time since we traveled without our wonderful kids and the peace and quiet were spectacular. We enjoyed excellent room service breakfast daily and appreciated the highest quality linens and bedding and bath products. 

Thank you to the entire staff from front of house to housekeeping for a wonderful stay.

reviews.title: Glorious Hotel
reviews.review_text:
Fabulous hotel that‚Äôs been updated with a modern flair while still maintaining the stunning Parisian palace that it domiciles. The rooms have been incredibly soundproofed and designed with a comfortable elegance that is perfect for relaxing after a long day of perusing the streets. Additionally, the service is kind, helpful, and a delight. 

The only dings (and they‚Äôre small ones), are the firmness of the mattress, the tiny size of the gym, and, the Cantonese restaurant whose food is TERRIBLE. Also, if this is your first trip to Paris, it‚Äôs not in the most central location but the metro is so easy to navigate it shouldn‚Äôt matter.

reviews.title: Unworthy of a palace, terrible experience
reviews.review_text:
am deeply disappointed by my recent experience at the Peninsula Paris, supposedly the epitome of elegance and hospitality. I had chosen to go to the lobby while waiting for a friend, with the intention of having a drink right after. To my great surprise, I was simply ‚Äúkicked out‚Äù of the lobby under the pretext that I was not drinking immediately and that I was not expecting anyone residing at the hotel.
People ask me who exactly I'm waiting for, what an indiscretion!
I have never been treated in such a humiliating manner in an establishment of this magnitude. I have gone very often to have breakfasts and even lunches in this establishment where I will never return, I will obviously tell my experience to other people around me
A man named SA√èD (I wonder how he was able to obtain such a position in charge of security) was arrogant, indelicate and disrespectful. I was made to feel like an unwanted intruder, even though I was planning to spend money at the hotel.
This behavior is unbecoming of a hotel of this reputation, and I strongly advise anyone not to go there if you expect a minimum of courtesy and professionalism. There are many other establishments in Paris that know how to treat their customers with respect and consideration, which is clearly not the case here.
Absolutely not worthy of a palace!

reviews.title: Reputation Well Earned and Exceeded
reviews.review_text: It's rare to find a place that lives up to its reputation, but this one does that and more. From the moment I engaged with them, I was impressed by their efficiency and warmth. The staff's expertise was evident, but what really stood out was their genuine desire to ensure I had the best possible experience. I left feeling not just satisfied, but truly impressed.

reviews.title: Isle of Serenity
reviews.review_text: Amazing Service. Beautiful Architecture and Exceptional Finishes. Food can be improved upon. Afternoon Tea is in a beautiful setting but sweet and savory offerings are not top quality. Great attention to detail. Had to change rooms because of some street noise on Rue des Portugais, but the hotel kindly upgraded me  to a much larger room on the court.

The hotel provides flexible event spaces, including 35 meeting rooms and one of the largest kitchens in Europe, ensuring tailored experiences for every guest. reviews.title: Best hotel location, amenities and views
reviews.review_text: We had a wonderful time in Paris. And staying at the Hyatt √âtoile was fabulous. The staff was wonderful. Check in was ready they held our luggage got us while we got started on our vacation. E had a junior suite since we were traveling with our adult son. This was adjoining Ron‚Äôs which was really ideal. The regency club is well worth it. Free full delicious breakfast every Day and 6-9pm happy hour with delicious snacks. The location was also ideal since port Msillot station a short walk or shortcut through Congres mall. Also walking distance toL‚Äô √©toile and the iconic L‚ÄôArc de Triomphe.  Beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower.  This is where we will stay from now on.

reviews.title: Amazing stay next to Metro
reviews.review_text: We had an amazing stay. The hotel is quiet, clean, and easy to find. You can walk through the mall to get into the hotel, or go through the main entrance. It‚Äôs close to the Metro, buses, and local trains. There are several restaurants nearby. We stayed on the 32nd floor and had a view of the Eiffel Tower. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Toiletries were provided as well as in room coffee, tea, and water. The club lounge was a wonderful perk, with a large variety of breakfast items. Snacks throughout the day were minimal but the evening happy hour had good variety. The hotel staff were very nice and accommodating.

reviews.title: Best Paris hotel!! Epic Eiffel Tower view!!
reviews.review_text: All fabulous.  Room ready at the expected time ie. Not early but that was fine they held our bags for us. Fabulous view of Tour d‚ÄôEiffel from our room and regency club.  Very convenient for US and poor adult son since we had adjoining rooms (junior suite).  The attached mall has a huge pharmacy and grocery store. Also direct access to Port Maillot metro from mall. Fab breakfast at regency club and evening happy hour was very nice.

reviews.title: Outpriced, outdated‚Ä¶ should be out
reviews.review_text:
Plain awful and outdated! 
I paid almost 600‚Ç¨ for an average sized room worth max a third of this in this hotel that looks like an industrial tourist factory overlooking the beautiful suburban highways of Paris outskirts. Room cleanliness was so so, clock was not even indicating proper time, bathroom is microscopic, given the size of the hotel, everything takes ages, in particular the elevators that run on a clearly suboptimal IT system and they‚Äôre still distributing plastic bottled water, this hotel is a shame and a robbery to be avoided at all costs! Fortunately staff was nice and helpful.

reviews.title: Great hotel in Paris
reviews.review_text: Very welcoming and beautiful hotel. Conveniently located steps from the metro, so easy access all around the city. Plenty of restaurants and shops walking distance from the hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean. Club lounge is a great benefit if available. Breakfast in the club lounge is the same food as the buffet offered in the lobby but was less busy and great views of the Eiffel Tower!

reviews.title: NOT BAD, COULD BE BETTER
reviews.review_text:
This is my first time staying at Citadine Tour Eiffel Paris, by Ascott Group.

The location of the hotel is very convenient, MRT metro station right in front of the hotel, McDonald + supermarkets + many restaurants around the hotel. The was a Sunday Morning Market under the train railway. We were so excited as that was the best way to see the local life and experience the local delicacy. 

My room was upgraded and was located at the corner, can enjoy the Eiffel Tower view at the living room. The living room is spacious. We also have a mini kitchenette too. So convenient to cook/reheat the food as there are stoves and microwave oven.

I love the water and coffee/tea dispenser machines at the lobby. Unlimited coffee/tea, hot chocolate, still & sparkling water are available 24hours. 

The lobby is not very big but it is cozy & modern + clean. You need to have keycard to access to the entrance from outside. Same goes to the guest floors access with keycard only for safety control.

When the train passing by, the vibration will notify you for every trip as the train railway just next to the hotel.

The whole staying experience can be enhanced further if we could feel the warm service + more cheerful smile to make us at ease, especially when we are travelling to a foreign country that we are not familiar with the local language, culture and environment. 

Warm service + friendly smile can earn another 2 stars to perfection for this stay!

reviews.title: Great family room
reviews.review_text: Very comfy family room, for our family of 4. Kids loved the free hot chocolate ma home in the foyer. I wish we‚Äôd spent the extra $1000AU and got the Eiffel Tower view for our 3 night stay. Maybe next time! Supermarket next door and plenty of eating options all around.

reviews.title: A estadia foi boa mas esperava mais de um hotel classificado como 4 estrelas
reviews.review_text:
Excelent location, close to the metro, bakeries and good restaurants and of course the Eiffel Tower
The lift has the floor cracked which makes a very bad impression since I was taking my husband in a romantic getaway. My stay was from Friday to Sunday and I didn‚Äôt get the room cleaned neither the towels and bed linens changed or even the trash was took away. The complimentary coffee downstairs didn‚Äôt have sugar almost all the time. The TV doesn‚Äôt have the option to mirror my cell screen, it is an important feature nowadays.

reviews.title: Wonderful Staff.  Excellent Location
reviews.review_text: Excellent location, within 15 minutes walking to the Eiffel Tower.   Our rooms have an excellent view of the Eiffel Tower.  It was a spectacular view at night, especially with the blinking lights of the Tower.   The bus stop and the metro line are in front of the hotel.  Tons of restaurants across the street.   The hotel staff was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions.

reviews.title: Lovely Stay
reviews.review_text: My wife and I were very satisfied with our stay at the Citadines Tour Eiffel. The front desk attendants were always courteous, patient and helpful (yes, they all spoke English). Our room was clean and comfortable. Very spacious. We didn't chose a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, which turned out to be a good choice for us  because once you leave the hotel, the Tower is in view from practically everywhere. A few quirks to be aware of; the key card needs to stay inserted in the room for the lights to work, and you must tap the key card to the motion sensor in the elevator or it won't go anywhere. Hopefully this tip will help others avoid our fate, which was to look like complete American idiots, pushing the button repeatedly to no avail until someone from the desk came to rescue us.  Our room was very quiet. There is an overhead train directly across the street. We could barely hear it, but we were on the other side of the building. I don't know if it is loud from the Eiffel-facing rooms. Of course, this was wonderful for getting around, as the Metro station is right across the street. There are a host of restaurants and shops in the neighborhood and the Eiffel Tower is within easy walking distance. Our only substantive criticism is that the air conditioning didn't keep the room very cool. It was in the 80's and humid during our stay, and the room was quite warm even with the air turned to the coldest setting. I imagine we'll have to get used to other countries being more energy conscious than the U.S. Overall, I would highly recommend Citadines Tour Eiffel!
