reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.review_text:
from checkin-to checkout everything was perfect. Especially desert in our room as welcome amenity was very delcious. 
Breakfast - Amazing breakfast. Restaurant is cozy and big enough to have perfect breakfast. Various and tasty selections for breakfast. You can have perfect start to your day
Location - Amazing. Its a bit away (30min walk) from Elysees but the walking way is along Seine is very nice/quite and plenty of things to discover about Paris. With taxi max 10min driving. But if you are fan of Eiffel - its the best location. From hotel to trocadero 10min nice walking way with perfect view.
Staff - Very helpfull. Especially Sarah GR manager and Stolic Tea who helped a lot. 
Room Size - I had deluxe room with balcony. Amazing room with Eiffel view and Size is perfect. You can relax there. 
Entertainment - No need to go outside for nice PAris evening - at least 2 nights. 1 nigt you can spend at top roof restaurant and enjoy Eiffel nioght view. and 2nd night in lobby restaurant where superb DJ is playing with cozy atmoshphere. Other nights you can go out ))
The only improvement area - in Deluxe room its not good to have  2 twin beds combined as King Bed)). Despite it did not affect lot, King bed itself makes big difference compare dto 2 twin beds combined as KING :)
Thanks Hotel team for their help in making my 5day trip to Paris relaxing and enjoyiable.

reviews.title: Terrific Tour Eiffel experience
reviews.review_text:
Short stay in Paris with comfortable room, good shower and efficient breakfast service.

Check in was relatively straightforward, reception area can get busy as groups meet.

Easy enough to arrange taxis to meet at front of hotel.

Easy access to promenade by the tower.

Thank you for looking after me.

reviews.title: Never, ever accept a room with interconnecting doors
reviews.review_text: This hotel is ideally situated in a safe area with good transport links and great views. Reception and restaurant staff were great. BUT I had the worst night‚Äôs sleep in a hotel of my life. The rooms with interconnecting doors to adjacent rooms (I was in 305) have absolutely no sound insulation from the adjoining rooms. The inconsiderate guest in Room 304 on 5th November talked on a phone for many hours, eventually finishing about 0430. And that was an hour after I had asked him to be quiet: he apologised‚Ä¶but carried on unabated. The doors are so thin, I could hear both his voice and that of his contact even though the phone was not on speaker. Value for money? Absolutely not.

reviews.title: Great location - that's it
reviews.review_text: Dreadful time at check in - took one hour.  TV didn't work, shower didn't drain - so we moved rooms.  The bar area outside looking up at Eiffel Tower was good - staff not really keen to serve though Dinner in the restaurant was ok, but not much choice for vegetarians.  The best thing is location.

reviews.title: Inability to consolidate charges properly
reviews.review_text: I recently stayed at Pullman Eiffel and, while the rooms were clean and the breakfast was enjoyable, I was deeply dissatisfied with their billing process. As a business traveler, I specifically asked the hotel staff if all charges‚Äîincluding breakfast and room service‚Äîcould be included on a single invoice for reimbursement purposes. They assured me this was possible. However, when I checked out, I discovered that these charges had already been processed separately by credit card and could not be added to the main invoice. The hotel staff claimed they didn‚Äôt have access to the restaurant charges, which was both unexpected and unacceptable. For business travelers who need comprehensive billing for expenses, this is a serious issue. While the hotel may be adequate for tourists, I would not recommend it for business stays due to their inability to consolidate charges properly. This experience was frustrating and potentially against standard hotel practices.

Shangri-La Paris Hotel.description: In the former home of Prince Roland Bonaparte, overlooking the Eiffel Tower and River Seine, ultimate Parisian elegance lives on in the French capital at Shangri-La Paris. This 19th century architectural gem has been listed in the French ‚ÄúMonuments Historiques‚Äù registry since 2009 and officially awarded the ‚ÄúPalace‚Äù status in 2014. Centrally located in the 16th arrondissement, minutes from the Champs-Elys√©es, the hotel blends European grandeur with traditional Asian hospitality. The hotel also boasts a 1 Michelin-starred restaurant, Shang Palace, along with seasonal dining experiences at the enchanting La Bauhinia.

reviews.title: Cultural Charm with World-Class ServiceOFFICIAL
reviews.review_text: An absolute treasure! The architectural details alone are worth the stay, but it's the staff that makes this place truly special. Their genuine smiles and willingness to go the extra mile created countless memorable moments. The rooms are spacious and well-thought-out, with touches of local culture that add authentic charm.

reviews.title: Thoughtful Luxury with Perfect Balance
reviews.review_text: This place has mastered the perfect balance between luxury and comfort. The attention to detail was evident everywhere - from the perfectly pressed linens to the curated local recommendations from staff. The public spaces were vibrant yet maintained peaceful corners for quiet moments. The breakfast spread was exceptional, and the evening turndown service added a lovely touch to ea

reviews.title: Eiffel Tour View
reviews.review_text:
Just Perfect 
The Eiffel Tower view was the best
I believe it‚Äôs the best hotel in France and Paris
We will see you again next year the same month like this year
And the breakfast was super Spesial 
Finally we were very lucky to find this hotel to booking

reviews.title: Business Traveler's Dream Come True
reviews.review_text: As a frequent business traveler, I've seen my fair share of hotels, but this one truly stands out. The seamless check-in process, well-appointed rooms with ergonomic workspaces, and high-speed Wi-Fi made work a breeze. The 24-hour fitness center and in-room dining options catered to my unpredictable schedule. What really set this hotel apart was the staff's professionalism an

reviews.title: Flawless Stay for Even the Pickiest Guests
reviews.review_text: I'm usually quite picky, but I couldn't fThe cleanliness was impeccable, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and the shower pressure was perfect (a rare find in hotels!)ind a single fault with this hotelThe staff were always available but never intrusive

Disneyland Paris.description:
Welcome to the place where everyone can shine their brightest!

Since opening in 1992, Disneyland Paris¬Æ has welcomed hundreds of millions of guests through its gates, making it Europe's number-one tourist destination

With the majestic Sleeping Beauty castle as its heart, Disneyland park is the fantastical home to five incredible lands. For 30 magical years, it's been the place where extraordinary stories come to life before your very eyes. Buckle up because you‚Äôre about to whizz around Discoveryland, Fantasyland, Frontierland, Adventureland, and Main Street U.S.A.¬Æ

Feel unique magic in the air, as the 30th Anniversary festive aura transforms Disneyland park into a vibrant wonderland. With stunning surroundings, the mesmerizing Gardens of Wonder, and many eye-catching surprises, you're sure to get swept up in the celebratory spirit.

As night falls, prepare to be amazed by the award-winning Disney D-Light, where spectacular drone light choreography illuminates the sky.

The Paris Catacombs.address: 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris France
The Paris Catacombs.description: A genuine labyrinth in the heart of underground Paris, this ossuary houses the remains of approximately six million Parisians. The history of the Catacombs dates back to the late 18th century when the city's cemeteries were closed due to health reasons and its contents were moved to an underground site. Today, you can walk down the spiral staircase and take a guided tour of the network of tunnels or explore it at your own pace. It's recommended to buy skip-the-line tickets online to avoid snaking lines. You can easily reach the Catacombs by hopping on the Paris Metro. ‚Äì Tripadvisor
The Paris Catacombs.address_string: 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris France

reviews.title: Great catacombs DO NOT USE HEADOUT TOURS
reviews.review_text:
Great experience and fascinating to understand the history behind the catacombs BUT don‚Äôt book through HEADOUT Paris is our advice. 
See HEADOUT Paris reviews for reasons.

reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
reviews.review_text: This is a must see. Save money and just go online and buy tickets for 29 Euros and take an Uber there-instead of over $100 on a tour formal tour. You wear an audio device that explains everything in great detail as you walk through. All the history around the catacombs.

reviews.title: Surreal experience...
reviews.review_text: This has been on my bucket list for a few yrs now and went back to Paris just to visit these catacombs..creepy but surreal experience to say the least.I did the self guided tour which was grand you just have to hang back abit from others to give yourself some space to take it all in.In my view it's a must see and I would highly recommend it.Tickets are really only sold on the official website and are only available 7 days in advance of your visit so 100% book online,they get realised at 10am Paris time each day in blocks of 15 mins and believe me when I say they sell out fast,most days are just about sold out by lunchtime so don't dilly dally waiting for a particular time I would just book what's available and work your day around it.You can't buy tickets onsite for same day.

reviews.title: Death in Paris
reviews.review_text: Go! This definitely was creepy. I've never been surrounded by aisles of bones and skulls before. You need to be able to walk a bit. We did not have a guide or use the self guided tour, we just walked and read what info was posted inside, which was adequate. Definitely different then any tourist experience I've ever had. It really did give me a chill. It somehow also connected me to Paris in seeing the bones of its now departed residents. I liked the gift shop at the end of the tour.

reviews.title: Interesting, but wouldn't go again
reviews.review_text:
The background story is very interesting, and the sheer number of people entombed here is impressive, but the overall experience is fairly monotonous.  

For those with limited mobility, you may want to reconsider as there are ~140 steps up and down into the catacombs and there is no elevator.  Additionally, there are damp gravel pathways and it's fairly dim down there.  My 75 y/o father did not enjoy it due to these issues.  I think they are well spelled out before you enter, but it was a lot for him.

There is also a long underground walk from the entrance building to the first sites, so again not a good idea if you have limited mobility.

reviews.title: Worst experience at Bir Hakeim Metro station
reviews.review_text:
We had to take the metro to reach our bus station, but the staff wouldn‚Äôt accept cash. Luckily, I had a virtual card, so we managed to pay. However, the ticket they gave us wouldn‚Äôt validate. When I went back to the staff for help, they told me to join the line again, even though it was super long and we were running late.

I politely asked for assistance again, but instead of helping, the staff started using foul language. I was with my sister, and we didn‚Äôt have time to argue, so I just let it go. In the end, they opened the gate for us, but it was a terrible experience.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend using the metro if you‚Äôre short on time. The staff was rude and unhelpful, and honestly, it didn‚Äôt feel safe. It‚Äôs disappointing that behavior like this goes unchecked.

reviews.title: WARNING METRO STAFF SCAM AND BULLY TOURISTS
reviews.review_text:
Awful experience on Metro - we bought tickets which but my partners didn't validate for some reason. Just after going through we were surrounded by 3 guards aggressively wanting to check tickets. When my partners was said to be 'invalid' as if it had not gone through the barrier they demanded a ‚Ç¨60 fine - no discussion. We explained we had just bought it with help from a staff member for the final journey we needed to make back to the Eurostar and asked if we could point her out. She stormed off and refused to let us point her out. When she returned she said the ticket office staff said no one helped!! They said they would call police which would raise the fine to ‚Ç¨200. They were bullying and aggressive and it was very clear there was a genuine mistake as they had watched us the whole time buying the ticket and go through. 
We will never visit Paris again and if you are going avoid the Metro - there is definately scamming there with tourists from the very people who should be looking out for you. What an awful way to treat tourists. Made me appreciate the UK and Londons underground staff. We were glad to be home and will not visit France again ever.

reviews.title: Fantastic System
reviews.review_text:
Just back from a 3 night stay in Paris with 2 children aged 14 and 12. I had lived in Paris 30 years ago, but my wife and kids were new to the city.

The Paris Metro system is fantastic. If you are staying in the city you are probably less than 250m from an entrance into the Metro and your destination is equally close to a stop. If your destination is on the same line as your start location just follow the signs for that line - there will be 2 options, one for each direction, and the direction is indicated by the name of the last station in that direction. Sometimes they will also list out the stops in each direction, but not always. If its on a different line you will need to change - this involves getting off at a stop and following signs for the next line/direction you need to take. You won't have to leave the Metro system, so you don't need a second ticket. 
We used the phone app Bonjour RATP to see the best route (including transfers). I would suggest practice using this app before you go if you are new to subway systems.

We used paper tickets as we didn't know how much we'd use the Metro, but a Navigo Easy card each preloaded with tickets would have been cheaper and simpler. There are other options such as day passes etc. The paper tickets we bought were called t+ tickets and they cover any journeys within the metro system except to Orly Airport.

Hang on to your ticket until you leave the Metro system! Twice we had to use the same ticket twice as there was a second set of turnstiles for some reason. Also, while we didn't see any ticket inspectors, they do check tickets and you'll be fined if you have thrown your ticket away.

A few words of warning:

Take precautions against pick pockets - they will target tourists and its hard to look like a local! Carriages can be crowded so valuables need to be well secured. We didn't see any pickpockets, but there were warnings everywhere. I also bought any tickets in Republique rather than the more touristy stations.

We took the Metro from Universite Saint Denis to Republic and back as we arrived on the bus from Beauvais airport. I felt it was quite challenging travelling as a family with suitcases in rush hour. We had to manoeuvre to make sure we were near the carriage doors so we could get out in time (Parisiens are impressively polite though!) If the kids were younger I would have looked into another form of transportation for this journey.

The system is old, and unlike more modern systems it doesn't seem very accessible. If you are unable to use stairs then do your research before travelling - while some stations have lifts I didn't see many.

Some Metro journeys involve quite a bit of walking within the system (to/from platforms, between lines etc)

Some trains are very busy - so you'll find yourself quite squashed in. The longest wait time we saw was 4 minutes though, so if you are concerned about a train being excessively full, then wait for the next one.

Conclusion:
Overall we took 12 journeys on the Metro in 3.5 days, most journeys took less than 20 minutes. We stayed in Republique, which has a number of lines, so most journeys didn't need a transfer. We packed loads into our trip to Paris and there is no way we could have seen and done as much without such an efficient form of transportation, and the kids really enjoyed the novelty of it.

reviews.title: Best metro !
reviews.review_text: Our second visit this year and it really is the easiest and best metro system have ever used. Fast efficient and fairly cheap, miles better than its London, New York or Berlin alternatives as have used them all. The navigo card is brilliant

reviews.title: About what you'd expect
reviews.review_text:
The paper tickets are tiny and stop working after like a day, no matter if it's meant to last a few days. Something to do with the magnetic strip if it touches your phone or if it gets bent so on. plus how can you keep track of a peice of paper that small for a few days. It's about 2cm high and 5cm wide. I wasted like ‚Ç¨20  because the ticket cost ‚Ç¨35 to begin with, that was meant to last 72 hours stopped working in 24 hours.

The staff will refuse to speak english and make you buy a Navigo card and ignore the fact you paid for a ticket. The Navigo card is better.

Subway was frequent if not crowded, easy to navigate and get around.

Paris by Mouth.description: There‚Äôs a reason why our tours are top-rated food tours on TripAdvisor and have been celebrated by The New York Times (twice!) and knowledgable foodies like David Lebovitz and Ruth Reichl: we keep our group sizes tiny, we spend generously at the best shops in town, and we only work with expert guides who have devoted their lives to food & wine. Our tours are in English and last for around 3 hours. They include some walking and standing, but also feature a seated tasting with wine pairings. Our tours are designed for adults. We‚Äôre unable to host children under ten years of age. Our price of 125‚Ç¨ per person is a little higher than the competition because we spend more than anyone else on premium tastings and to pay the most experienced and knowledgable guides in Paris. You‚Äôre also paying for the tiny group size. You can visit our website to see our calendar of availability, and we hope to welcome you soon!

reviews.title: Cheese!
reviews.review_text: I did the French Cheese Explosion with Jennifer and it exceeded all expectations. The cheeses (and the wine pairings) were outstanding and I learned so much. Jennifer is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about cheese. Definitely a highlight of my trip to Paris.

reviews.title: Marion is the MOF of tour guides!
reviews.review_text: We did the left bank tour and Marion is the MOF of tour guides.  We loved our tour experience!  The tour takes you on a great walk around, and was very informative about what to look for when shopping for bread, cheese, chocolate, wine/champagne, and pastries.  Marion is so fun to spend the afternoon with and has so much knowledge about the Paris food scene.  Everything we ate was absolutely delicious.  Highly suggest doing a tour on your first day in Paris to help with jet lag and give you insights for your stay.

reviews.title: Tour with Mathieu - I couldn't recommend this enough!
reviews.review_text: My fiance and I did North Marais food tour in November 2024 led by Mathieu. We had such an amazing time on this tour! Mathieu was a very knowledgable, engaging, and fun tour guide. We got to walk around a neighborhood of Paris we were interested in but also got to visit and enjoy the best food spots in that area. Everything we ate was delicous and we even got a little history along the way. We ate croissants, fresh baguette, chocolate/candies, cheese, wine and some traditional french food as well. Our walking tour ended at a wine store where we did the wine and cheese tasting. Our group was the perfect size (3 couples with our tour guided). I couldn't recommend this enough!

reviews.title: Wonderful food tour
reviews.review_text: We did the left bank tour with Marion and it was amazing. We enjoyed all the food and learned a lot about French cheese and French wine which was one thing we wanted from the tour. Marion was very knowledgeable and friendly, would highly recommend. If I could suggest any improvement it would be another wine to taste as there was a lot of cheese to get through. Also if there could be a few minutes at the different stops to shop if you wished as not everyone will have a chance to return to the shops on their trip.

reviews.title: French reverence for the table
reviews.review_text:
What a fantastic way to learn about a small corner of Paris. While the food and wine were delicious, they became touchstones for the history that our guide was sharing with us. Victorine is a genuine and passionate ambassador of French culture and Paris by Mouth is on to an exciting teaching model. If you want to begin to understand a people, understand their approach to food.

Brava, Victorine, brava!

Galeries Lafayette Paris Haussmann.description: Visitors to this massive department store can find brand-name items of nearly every variety. Shop accessible to luxury fashion & accessories for men, women and children, enjoy exclusive services such as personal shoppers, concierge and tax refunds and indulge in restaurants and a gourmet epicerie.

reviews.title: Nice building
reviews.review_text: Nice building, beautiful decoratios, a lot of very well known shops, cold staff. From the terrace you can have a beautiful view on Paris

reviews.title: Not the average shopping mall!
reviews.review_text: We had a day in Paris with a group of friends including several teenagers so we wanted to visit Lafayette. We wanted to get the experience, see the dome and visit the rooftop. It is beautiful, even if you don‚Äôt like shopping it is nice to walk inside and just look up to the beautiful dome. We saw the glasswalk at the 3rd floor and went there, to find out they work with reservations with time-slots. Luckily the ladies in charge helped us to make the reservation on the spot and we could go without too much of waiting. It is very nice to walk on the glass floor and have a view from there. After that we went to the rooftop for an even better view of Paris. We wanted to visit the restaurant but with that one we had less luck as  it was full. But there were some beach chairs we could use to enjoy the view. We walked around inside as well and really enjoyed the experience.

reviews.title: Fun and Different
reviews.review_text: This was a fun class to learn new baking techniques. Not a typical tourist attraction, would highly recommend.

reviews.title: Fun and professional
reviews.review_text: Very good preparation in a nice venue right in the Galeries, a small group, great communication, a sweet professional, I can highly recommend! Thank you!

reviews.title: Amazing view of Paris from the rooftop!
reviews.review_text:
Such an unique and beautiful shopping centre, Parisian chiq, very expensive but the rooftop is free and so worth it! 
We loved the atmosphere there, would like to come back to this mall.

ExperienceFirst Paris.description: Make the most of your visit. ExperienceFirst's award winning tours create memorable experiences and save time for our guests through optimized itinerary, skip the line tickets and great guides.

Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris.address: 6 Parvis Notre-Dame Place Jean-Paul II, 75004 Paris France
Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris.description: The iconic Notre Dame Cathedral Paris‚Äîmeaning ‚ÄòOur Lady of Paris‚Äô‚Äîis a masterpiece of French Gothic architecture. Built back in the 12th century, the important monument has witnessed many historical events. It has also inspired Victor Hugo‚Äôs story of the Hunchback of Notre-Dame. Outside the cathedral, you can admire its grand exterior which is framed by an elegant pair of bell towers, stained glass windows and an ornately decorated facade with grand statues. You can also enter the cathedral for a small entrance fee to view Nio-Gothic artwork and furniture as well as join their weekly sessions. ‚Äì Tripadvisor
Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris.address_string: 6 Parvis Notre-Dame Place Jean-Paul II, 75004 Paris France

reviews.title: Resurrection
reviews.review_text: The corner stone of Notre-Dame de Paris was laid more than 860 years ago and, over those centuries, the cathredral has survived war and revolution‚Äîeven the terrible fire of 2019. The publication of Victor Hugo‚Äôs novel ‚ÄúThe Hunchback of Notre-Dame‚Äù in 1831 renewed interest in preserving what by then had become little more than a rundown landmark. Even the iconic wooden spire was a later addition, having been added in 1859. At the time of the fire, a five-year goal was set for the restoration of the cathredral. Given that it took almost 200 years to build, some thought that two or three times that number might be needed. But now, an opening date of December 7 has been officially announced, just a month away‚Äîalthough further work will continue for another year or two. These pictures, which were taken on a misty Sunday in October, show how much has been done‚Äîand still to be completed.

reviews.title: Opens December 2024!
reviews.review_text: Opens in December of 2024, we were 3 months early but had to see.  Wish to come back, the history is haunting, and the view is magnificent.

reviews.title: impressive and majestic!
reviews.review_text:
I went to Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris. I had an excellent time, the place is really beautiful and the building is majestic. The guided tour gave us a lot of information about the history of the place, and I was able to discover some incredible anecdotes about the illustrious figures who have built the cathedral. The interior of the building is filled with paintings and stained glass windows that let in a beautiful light. 

Netherless,the place is packed with tourist. Try to choose less busy times to avoid the waiting queues for the audio guides !

Enjoy your trip !

reviews.title: Opens in December again
reviews.review_text: Even though it wasn‚Äôt open, it was definitely worth walking around. You could see a lot of activity on defense. They have a lot of highlights of the inside the fire and significant of Benson people. If you‚Äôre in the area, I would definitely take the time to walk around.

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.review_text: We didnt get the chance to go inside as it was under construction.The buildingis so beatiful.we just viewed it by outside.

Big Bus Paris.address: 11 avenue de l'Opera Stop 1, 75001 Paris France
Big Bus Paris.description: Hop on board an open-top bus with 360-degree views and explore all that Paris has to offer ! From historic sites and iconic architecture to bustling streets and the world famous Eiffel Tower ‚Äì immerse yourself in the rich history and culture of the French capital. Explore Paris and enjoy the ultimate freedom to take in the city at your own pace. A choice of live guided commentary in English on our red route or recorded commentary in 11 languages are available.
Big Bus Paris.address_string: 11 avenue de l'Opera Stop 1, 75001 Paris France

Le Marais.description: Get lost in one of the most charming neighborhoods in Paris, brimming with unique boutiques and stylish art galleries. Besides its vibrant LGBTQIA+ community, Le Marais also has a rich Jewish heritage, with winding streets lined with historic medieval architecture. If you're looking for a night out, head to one of the many gay bars or clubs that the area is known for. Take a walking tour to discover fascinating insights about the neighborhood, or a food tour to have a taste of the area's vibrant culinary scene‚Äîtravelers say the falafel is some of the best! Visit during the week for fewer crowds and wear comfortable walking shoes to navigate the neighborhood's cobblestone streets. ‚Äì Tripadvisor

reviews.title: One of the Top 5 Iconic site in Paris
reviews.review_text:
Le Marais has become a trendy district of the Marais. Definitely Iconic like the Latin Quarter and La Rive Gauche, as its graffitis sometimes prove it. 
It is located in the 4th arrondissement. It is full of museums, trendy boutiques, galleries and bars, some of which are gay. 
It also used to contain the Jewish quarter of the city. This district is still home to many kosher restaurants.
Another iconic site is the Place des Vosges, verdant, which houses elegant arcades and the Victor Hugo museum, where the writer lived. 
The streets around the Saint-Paul metro station lead to the Maison Europ√©enne de la Photographie but you have not less intersting museums such as Les Archives Nationales and Le Musee Carnavalet, ideal for rainy days.

But actually if we forget the trendy aspect of the Marais, I love it for its narrow streets and its Louis XIII architecture which takes me back to the history of Paris.

reviews.title: Best place in Paris
reviews.review_text: Place to be. Was here for whole october and there is no boring days at all. People are nice and really international. Also lot of great restaurants and coffee shops

reviews.title: Charming area of the Right Bank to explore in Paris
reviews.review_text:
This is a charming district on the Right Bank in central Paris. There are quieter neighbourhoods you can stroll as well as important sightseeing including several museums, churches and historic hotels, Opera house, quaint public squares and monuments to enjoy. 

You will also find a nice range of hotels and dining opportunities, all nicely connected to the rest of the city by buses and the Metro. It is a really nice location of Paris to spend a day or more exploring, even longer if you plan to stay overnight in this area of the city.

reviews.title: A Charming Parisian Neighborhood
reviews.review_text: Le Marais is absolutely perfect! Our apartment was right next to the Place des Vosges, and we were surrounded by great restaurants, bakeries, and grocery stores. Plus, there are two free museums just a 2-5 minute walk away. The area is truly beautiful.

reviews.title: Le Marais is perfect
reviews.review_text: This neighborhood has it all; museums, history and food abound.  The young energy and edgy fashions make it a constant feast for the eye.  Our apartment was quiet and restful for evenings, yet riveting nightlife is only a block away.

Paris Las Vegas.address: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4345
Paris Las Vegas.description: You won‚Äôt get a view like this at any other Las Vegas pool. Pool √° Par√≠s is located right underneath the hotel‚Äôs Eiffel Tower replica at Paris Las Vegas, positioned in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. Take rest and relaxation to the next level with a lounge chair, daybed or cabana rental at Pool √° Par√≠s. The romantic atmosphere paired with various amenities will leave you rejuvenated and ready for the evening on the famed Las Vegas Strip.
Paris Las Vegas.address_string: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4345

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Paris stay
reviews.review_text: Our room had amazing views and was spacious, comfortable and clean. Easy check in and friendly accommodating staff. It was a hike to the Versailles tower from check-in as they hadn‚Äôt finished the direct walkway yet but taxis and transportation were close to the bottom of the elevators. Pools were great as were the variety of restaurants and food. Staying there again for NFR we liked it so well.

reviews.title: This is NOT a 4-star hotel
reviews.review_text: This is NOT a 4-star hotel by any stretch of the imagination.  The rooms are very dated, sheets dirty with holes, missing knob on the dresser and the check-in staff was rude.  The restaurants are limited in this hotel.  The best thing about this hotel is the location, the bellhop, housekeeping, and wait staff were nice.  Other that that, there's nothing.

reviews.title: Go somewhere else
reviews.review_text: Please go somewhere else - pay a bit more if you have to. The queue for check in was over an hour - we were slightly early and were told to either pay $50 for early check in or join the queue again. There was an automatic check in machine but it wasn't working. There was only 3 clerks on, and the queue was out of the reception and into the casino.We were celebrating our 41st wedding anniversary and asked if an upgrade was possible and the clerk literally snorted and laughed at us.  I said that I didn't expect that response, she told us that the staff were not allowed to arrange upgrades, and she was fed up of people asking, and she was thinking of just walking out, and how stressed and understaffed they were, and her manager didn't care. We paid for the early check in, just so we didn't have to queue again. It certainly put a dampener on our visit.The room was dated but OK, but no tea or coffee making facilities. We asked if we could get a kettle and were told that no rooms have that facility any more. $8 for a cup of very weak tea was a bit excessive, I thought, and when I asked for another tea bag as it was so weak, was asked for another $8! Lots of very drunk and noisy people coming back to their rooms during the night and shouting and slamming doors. There was a lot of mess in the corridors- dropped popcorn etc, and this was not cleared up. We visited lots of the other hotels, and none of them had such problems with checking in queues. We found the reception staff off hand and unfriendly, and the bar staff weren't much better. We ordered a coctkail for me and my husband asked for a whiskey. The barman asked which one, and my husband ordered one. "That's a Scotch, not a whiskey says the barman" - we giggled and said - oh that's what you call it over here- he very rudely replied that it was called Scotch everywhere, and you should know what you want to order and avoid me wasting my time having to explain things to you. This trip to Las Vegas was part of a special holiday and the visit to Paris Hotel was the lowest point in our trip. The customer care was much better in other hotels - we used the bars there. Go some where else

reviews.title: Paris Las Vegas Just Meh
reviews.review_text:
The hotel is nice enough, clean, beautiful decor, room was fine.  We had a pool view, and the windows were so dirty that the view was obstructed.  We aren't high-rolling gamblers and that has a strong affect on how customers are treated.  Desk clerks are "low talkers", quickly making offers for upgrades if you pay extra, and if you decline, they're not very nice. Check in system is antiquated, one long line to see a clerk; we paid for early check in, but they wanted you to get back in the line when you're room is ready, instead of using the kiosks in the lobby.  Not sure why they aren't using modern technology. 
 Best part - we paid the extra $80+tax for a lounger bed at the pool - it gave us a great afternoon, includes bottled waters, and the pool area is beautiful; staff at pool were very friendly.  Worst part - no coffee in the room and in the hotel restaurants, it's $9+ a cup!  That's ridiculous.  They have a fridge in the room, they could have coffee makers like every other hotel in the USA.  I signed up for Caesars Rewards and it proved to be useless, unless you're spending lots of money in the casino.  There is also a lot of construction in the area, so even the Bellagio fountains were partially obstructed.

reviews.title: WARNING ABOUT PARIS HOTEL VEGAS
reviews.review_text:
ATTENTION EVERYONE, A WARNING about the PARIS HOTEL IN VEGAS: NEVER stay here because it is NOT safe. There seems to be an inside job happening that you‚Äôd never suspect. The worst part is when I reported it to the front desk, they didn‚Äôt care at all. They made me wait and did nothing. Security was no help either. I asked them to check the cameras by the elevator to identify who went into my room, but they refused, saying it‚Äôs ‚Äòconfidential.‚Äô I had a gut feeling something was off.

So please, if you‚Äôre going to Vegas, be extra careful. Bring additional locks because even if your door is locked, they can still open it with their own keys. So, PEOPLE, DO NOT stay at the Paris Hotel in Vegas. At first, the staff seems nice, but once you check in, you‚Äôre on your own. They don‚Äôt care about you, your comfort, or helping you in any way. I‚Äôm not just upset about my stolen backpack‚Äîthis is a warning for others to know what‚Äôs really going on at Paris Hotel in Vegas. Even if you lock your door, they have their own key.

I‚Äôm not going to stress over it anymore, but since they‚Äôre NOT helping me or even showing basic concern, I will make sure my story is heard. People need to know that this PARIS HOTEL IS NOT SAFE. These thieves are professionals, and it feels like they somehow knew exactly when I was alone in the room while my husband and brother-in-law were at a concert. How else would they know exactly where I put my backpack?

I lost so many valuable and sentimental items: my wedding ring, a pearl ring with diamonds that was a graduation gift from my sister, and other precious jewelry with memories attached, plus my wallet, driver‚Äôs license, and credit cards. Yes, these are just things, and I‚Äôm thankful I‚Äôm safe and my dog is unharmed, but people need to know what‚Äôs happening at this Pais hotel. When will they take action‚Äîwhen someone gets hurt?

My triplet siblings and I came to Vegas to celebrate our 50th birthday early, arriving on Tuesday, September 17, 2024. Everything was great until our last day, Saturday, September 21,2024 our birthday. What a heartbreaking way to end our trip. üò¢üòî

Paris.description: Lingering over pain au chocolat in a sidewalk caf√©, relaxing after a day of strolling along the Seine and marveling at icons like the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe‚Ä¶ the perfect Paris experience combines leisure and liveliness with enough time to savor both an exquisite meal and exhibits at the Louvre. Awaken your spirit at Notre Dame, bargain hunt at the March√© aux Puces de Montreuil or for goodies at the March√© Biologique Raspail, then cap it all off with a risqu√© show at the Moulin Rouge.

reviews.title: Amazing food and service! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
reviews.review_text:
Beautiful food and fantastic service from staff. We had been on the move all day in Paris without a bite to eat and stumbled across this lovely little place. I had a Frutti Di Mare (Seafood Pizza) and my husband had a Bolognaise pasta - both were beautiful meals. The pizza dough was the best I have ever tasted. 

Staff provided a fantastic service and we received a warm welcome. We will be back when we visit Paris, thank you.

reviews.title: Really a Hidden gem
reviews.review_text:
A hidden gem (and secret!), perfect location right around the l'Arc de Triomphe and the best service ever! Starting with an amazing breakfast - French style from the bread to the cheese and local products - to really great personal service including an early morning wake-up call. Even being a little late for breakfast or early the next day and rushing out, to-go bag included. 

I can only truly recommend this gem in the heart of the city, just a stroll from the Champs-Elysees!

reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.review_text: The staff at Hotel Du Danube were absolutely phenomenal! So welcoming and nice and always answered our questions or gave advice on what to do, see, or eat. The location of the hotel can not be beat. Centrally located, we walked literally to every major tourist site with absolutely no issues. I would book a trip back to Paris just for this hotel experience alone!

Disneyland Paris.description:
Welcome to the place where everyone can shine their brightest!

Since opening in 1992, Disneyland Paris¬Æ has welcomed hundreds of millions of guests through its gates, making it Europe's number-one tourist destination

With the majestic Sleeping Beauty castle as its heart, Disneyland park is the fantastical home to five incredible lands. For 30 magical years, it's been the place where extraordinary stories come to life before your very eyes. Buckle up because you‚Äôre about to whizz around Discoveryland, Fantasyland, Frontierland, Adventureland, and Main Street U.S.A.¬Æ

Feel unique magic in the air, as the 30th Anniversary festive aura transforms Disneyland park into a vibrant wonderland. With stunning surroundings, the mesmerizing Gardens of Wonder, and many eye-catching surprises, you're sure to get swept up in the celebratory spirit.

As night falls, prepare to be amazed by the award-winning Disney D-Light, where spectacular drone light choreography illuminates the sky.

Paris Las Vegas.address: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109
Paris Las Vegas.description: Experience everything you love about Paris, in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. The city of lights shine on the strip. One night with us is all it takes to realize everything's sexier in Paris. Give in to your every desire at Paris Las Vegas Hotel and Casino, whether you crave decadent dining, world-class entertainment or thrilling nightlife. Guest rooms at Paris Las Vegas Hotel & Casino have a distinctly chic European look, with Versailles-style fixtures and luxury romantic d√©cor. Red Rooms are sophisticated and modern while the splurge-worthy Louis XV Suite features chandeliers and oversized bathtubs.
Paris Las Vegas.address_string: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

reviews.title: 3 day stay!
reviews.review_text: We stayed 3 nights at Paris.  The casino was great and the restaurants were as well.  But the rooms have not been taken care of at all.  Probably will not stay again unless the rooms have been updated.  Very sad, this used to be the place to stay but not anymore.

reviews.title: Better than these reviews say
reviews.review_text: We enjoyed our stay at Paris last weekend. Yes the line to check in was very long, however there are multiple electronic stations where you can check in yourself and that line was short, so we checked in within a few minutes, even adding late checkin for ourselves with no issue. The beds were comfortable, the room was very clean, and the shower was probably the largest hotel shower I've ever seen. We had the prefix brunch at the Eiffel Tower restaurant; I highly recommend the creme brulee french toast, it was incredible. I would definitely stay at Paris again.

reviews.title: Worn down somewhat
reviews.review_text: I was there 2 or 3 years ago and was impressed....but, that was then...my latest trip was not as impressive. Hotel rooms have worn down somewhat. Peeling wallpaper, thread bare carpet patches, awful dingy hard towels an dirty bed linens. It could have been worse, my travel companions room had dirty underwear,  filthy tubs and pills on the floor, they changed rooms and it was just as dirty with difficulties getting housekeeping services. Expected better for the price...

reviews.title: Hotel was nice, but beds were so uncomfortable
reviews.review_text: The hotel was nice overall. The bathroom was clean with the exception of an old bar of soap with hair on it. The beds though were so uncomfortable. The sheets were also very rough and made our skin red. Overall I‚Äôd say 3/5 stars. Mostly because we didn‚Äôt get much sleep due to the bed situation

reviews.title: Cold Water Conference
reviews.review_text: Stayed with Paris Hotel numerous times for the annual SEMA show.  Usually with a Nice experience.  This visit however was 1st met with a Room and a Safe that would Not function.  Calling down to the main office, we than had a person visit and confirm, the Safe Inoperable.  Paris moved us to another room on the same floor and we settled in.  Only to realize the sink would not provide Warm to Hot water until it was running for 10-15 minutes straight.   This is huge with more than one person in the room, and a complete waste of water.   Oddly enough, the shower would warm up in a normal manner.  Secondly, the TV would lose internet connectivity so often that we would give up on watching TV in the early morning or evening.

Ritz Paris.description: Located on the iconic Place Vend√¥me, the Ritz Paris is one of the most legendary hotels in the City of Lights. Refinement of French art de vivre meets elegance of Belle √âpoque d√©cor. Exquisitely appointed 71 rooms and 71 suites bear the name of F. Scott Fitzgerald or Marcel Proust. Ritz Paris is a place where dreams come to life. The famous Bar Vend√¥me welcomes guests to savor dishes at any hour of the day while the Ritz Bar is the perfect place to enjoy zodiac-themed cocktails. Ritz Paris Le Comptoir celebrates modern conviviality and French gourmandise, with exceptional pastries by Chef Fran√ßois Perret. At the √âcole Ritz Escoffier, enthusiasts, from novice to professional, can perfect their approach to French cuisine and pastry-making. The Ritz Club & Spa and its sumptuous pool elevates well-being to an art form. Last but not least, Salon Proust is the place to enjoy a delightful teatime √† la fran√ßaise and no visit to the Ritz Paris would be complete without stopping by the iconic Bar Hemingway.

reviews.title: If a mistake is made, quick reparations are done.
reviews.review_text:
I attended the Escoffier class in the morning and was escorted to the room personally, a lovely touch. However, another woman's purse and luggage was located within. 

Prompt apologies were communicated and my luggage was delivered within 15 minutes or so. My fatigue was overwhelming so I declined the offer to unpack. 

Later, I looked in the Hemingway bar which intimate but doesn't open up for conversation with its limited seats at the bar. You need to bring your friends with you.

I moved to the Vendome bar with lovely piano tunes and had a lively conversation with an attorney from Finland and later, a couple from Australia. Ambiance and environment were super.

reviews.title: Perfect in every way!
reviews.review_text:
This was my first stay at the Ritz, but it won‚Äôt be my last. Every staff member that I encountered was professional but friendly and made me feel quite welcomed. 

One of the great perks of a stay at the Ritz is that your room is ready when you arrive, regardless of the time (as long as you let them know your arrival time in advance).  Many flights from the US arrive quite early in the morning, so this was a huge plus for me. It is also possible to delay check out until 3 pm on your day of departure. 

I have already booked a second stay for January 2025

reviews.title: Beautiful place but food only average
reviews.review_text: Had lunch in the Ritz on Monday after Arc weekend.. Nice table in garden room.. very good Regnard wine.. we ordered 2 Croque Monsieur and  a chicken Caesar Salad.. the service was very good.. polite, friendly and professional... the food was a let down, unfortunately.. it was well presented and in a timely fashion.. but the salad was lacking in taste and flavour.. the Croque was described as average by those who ate it.. cocktails after lunch were lovely... it was a pity about the food.. fabulous place though.. our wine waiter, Axel, was the epitome of French charm at it's best..

reviews.title: Chapter and Verse of Comfort
reviews.review_text: As a bookworm, I was in heaven. Each floor was themed after a different literary genre, with quotes adorning the walls and books available to borrow everywhere. The cozy reading nooks scattered throughout were perfect for losing oneself in a story. The staff, well-versed in literature, were always ready with a recommendation. It was a bibliophile's dream come true!

reviews.title: Epitome of parisian luxury
reviews.review_text:
This hotel is truly in a league of its own. The concierge service deserves special mention - their knowledge and efficiency were outstanding. They anticipated our needs and made excellent recommendations that enhanced our Paris experience.
the attention to detail throughout the hotel is remarkable. from the exquisitely appointed rooms to the flawless service in every interaction, the ritz maintains its reputation as an icon of luxury hospitality.
While the stay was short, the memories will last a lifetime. for those seeking the pinnacle of parisian luxury, the ritz paris delivers an unforgettable experience that justifies its legendary status. truly a 5-star gem in every sense.

The Paris Catacombs.address: 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris France
The Paris Catacombs.description: A genuine labyrinth in the heart of underground Paris, this ossuary houses the remains of approximately six million Parisians. The history of the Catacombs dates back to the late 18th century when the city's cemeteries were closed due to health reasons and its contents were moved to an underground site. Today, you can walk down the spiral staircase and take a guided tour of the network of tunnels or explore it at your own pace. It's recommended to buy skip-the-line tickets online to avoid snaking lines. You can easily reach the Catacombs by hopping on the Paris Metro. ‚Äì Tripadvisor
The Paris Catacombs.address_string: 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris France

reviews.title: Great catacombs DO NOT USE HEADOUT TOURS
reviews.review_text:
Great experience and fascinating to understand the history behind the catacombs BUT don‚Äôt book through HEADOUT Paris is our advice. 
See HEADOUT Paris reviews for reasons.

reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
reviews.review_text: This is a must see. Save money and just go online and buy tickets for 29 Euros and take an Uber there-instead of over $100 on a tour formal tour. You wear an audio device that explains everything in great detail as you walk through. All the history around the catacombs.

reviews.title: Surreal experience...
reviews.review_text: This has been on my bucket list for a few yrs now and went back to Paris just to visit these catacombs..creepy but surreal experience to say the least.I did the self guided tour which was grand you just have to hang back abit from others to give yourself some space to take it all in.In my view it's a must see and I would highly recommend it.Tickets are really only sold on the official website and are only available 7 days in advance of your visit so 100% book online,they get realised at 10am Paris time each day in blocks of 15 mins and believe me when I say they sell out fast,most days are just about sold out by lunchtime so don't dilly dally waiting for a particular time I would just book what's available and work your day around it.You can't buy tickets onsite for same day.

reviews.title: Death in Paris
reviews.review_text: Go! This definitely was creepy. I've never been surrounded by aisles of bones and skulls before. You need to be able to walk a bit. We did not have a guide or use the self guided tour, we just walked and read what info was posted inside, which was adequate. Definitely different then any tourist experience I've ever had. It really did give me a chill. It somehow also connected me to Paris in seeing the bones of its now departed residents. I liked the gift shop at the end of the tour.

reviews.title: Interesting, but wouldn't go again
reviews.review_text:
The background story is very interesting, and the sheer number of people entombed here is impressive, but the overall experience is fairly monotonous.  

For those with limited mobility, you may want to reconsider as there are ~140 steps up and down into the catacombs and there is no elevator.  Additionally, there are damp gravel pathways and it's fairly dim down there.  My 75 y/o father did not enjoy it due to these issues.  I think they are well spelled out before you enter, but it was a lot for him.

There is also a long underground walk from the entrance building to the first sites, so again not a good idea if you have limited mobility.

reviews.title: Hello Paris!
reviews.review_text: Great location, friendly service excellent housekeeping, overall a great experience! Definitely the best hotel in town.

reviews.title: Hotel Heaven
reviews.review_text: Once again another fabulous stay at Le Bristol! If heaven has a hotel this would be it. Every detail in the room from the bed to the towels is perfect. The concierge team is outstanding , they took care of all of our dining and tours. The staff is so friendly and sincere can't wait to return again.

reviews.title: Still the One
reviews.review_text: We have stayed at this luxury hotel multiple times over the years. With each returning visit, there are pleasant surprises, as the team is always exploring new ways to enhance the space, the brand and the experience. What doesn't change is the culture of top drawer hospitality and extraordinary service that is consistent in everything they do and everywhere you turn. Old school excellence, elegance and warmth at its best. We look forward to returning next year...if we can wait that long.

reviews.title: Exceptional in every way!
reviews.review_text: Just about perfect in every way, true grande dame boutique hotel. Gorgeous on inside and outside, beautiful lobby and rooms, 3 star Michelin restaurant, phenomenal food, service and attentiveness. Pretty much our favorite hotel in the world!  Yes, it's very expensive but perfection is not cheap!

reviews.title: Delightful Discovery
reviews.review_text: This place is a breath of fresh air in a world of cookie-cutter experiences. The attention to detail is remarkable, from the thoughtful layout to the personalized service. Every aspect seems designed to delight and surprise. The staff's genuine enthusiasm is contagious, making e

reviews.title: Worst experience at Bir Hakeim Metro station
reviews.review_text:
We had to take the metro to reach our bus station, but the staff wouldn‚Äôt accept cash. Luckily, I had a virtual card, so we managed to pay. However, the ticket they gave us wouldn‚Äôt validate. When I went back to the staff for help, they told me to join the line again, even though it was super long and we were running late.

I politely asked for assistance again, but instead of helping, the staff started using foul language. I was with my sister, and we didn‚Äôt have time to argue, so I just let it go. In the end, they opened the gate for us, but it was a terrible experience.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend using the metro if you‚Äôre short on time. The staff was rude and unhelpful, and honestly, it didn‚Äôt feel safe. It‚Äôs disappointing that behavior like this goes unchecked.

reviews.title: WARNING METRO STAFF SCAM AND BULLY TOURISTS
reviews.review_text:
Awful experience on Metro - we bought tickets which but my partners didn't validate for some reason. Just after going through we were surrounded by 3 guards aggressively wanting to check tickets. When my partners was said to be 'invalid' as if it had not gone through the barrier they demanded a ‚Ç¨60 fine - no discussion. We explained we had just bought it with help from a staff member for the final journey we needed to make back to the Eurostar and asked if we could point her out. She stormed off and refused to let us point her out. When she returned she said the ticket office staff said no one helped!! They said they would call police which would raise the fine to ‚Ç¨200. They were bullying and aggressive and it was very clear there was a genuine mistake as they had watched us the whole time buying the ticket and go through. 
We will never visit Paris again and if you are going avoid the Metro - there is definately scamming there with tourists from the very people who should be looking out for you. What an awful way to treat tourists. Made me appreciate the UK and Londons underground staff. We were glad to be home and will not visit France again ever.

reviews.title: Fantastic System
reviews.review_text:
Just back from a 3 night stay in Paris with 2 children aged 14 and 12. I had lived in Paris 30 years ago, but my wife and kids were new to the city.

The Paris Metro system is fantastic. If you are staying in the city you are probably less than 250m from an entrance into the Metro and your destination is equally close to a stop. If your destination is on the same line as your start location just follow the signs for that line - there will be 2 options, one for each direction, and the direction is indicated by the name of the last station in that direction. Sometimes they will also list out the stops in each direction, but not always. If its on a different line you will need to change - this involves getting off at a stop and following signs for the next line/direction you need to take. You won't have to leave the Metro system, so you don't need a second ticket. 
We used the phone app Bonjour RATP to see the best route (including transfers). I would suggest practice using this app before you go if you are new to subway systems.

We used paper tickets as we didn't know how much we'd use the Metro, but a Navigo Easy card each preloaded with tickets would have been cheaper and simpler. There are other options such as day passes etc. The paper tickets we bought were called t+ tickets and they cover any journeys within the metro system except to Orly Airport.

Hang on to your ticket until you leave the Metro system! Twice we had to use the same ticket twice as there was a second set of turnstiles for some reason. Also, while we didn't see any ticket inspectors, they do check tickets and you'll be fined if you have thrown your ticket away.

A few words of warning:

Take precautions against pick pockets - they will target tourists and its hard to look like a local! Carriages can be crowded so valuables need to be well secured. We didn't see any pickpockets, but there were warnings everywhere. I also bought any tickets in Republique rather than the more touristy stations.

We took the Metro from Universite Saint Denis to Republic and back as we arrived on the bus from Beauvais airport. I felt it was quite challenging travelling as a family with suitcases in rush hour. We had to manoeuvre to make sure we were near the carriage doors so we could get out in time (Parisiens are impressively polite though!) If the kids were younger I would have looked into another form of transportation for this journey.

The system is old, and unlike more modern systems it doesn't seem very accessible. If you are unable to use stairs then do your research before travelling - while some stations have lifts I didn't see many.

Some Metro journeys involve quite a bit of walking within the system (to/from platforms, between lines etc)

Some trains are very busy - so you'll find yourself quite squashed in. The longest wait time we saw was 4 minutes though, so if you are concerned about a train being excessively full, then wait for the next one.

Conclusion:
Overall we took 12 journeys on the Metro in 3.5 days, most journeys took less than 20 minutes. We stayed in Republique, which has a number of lines, so most journeys didn't need a transfer. We packed loads into our trip to Paris and there is no way we could have seen and done as much without such an efficient form of transportation, and the kids really enjoyed the novelty of it.

reviews.title: Best metro !
reviews.review_text: Our second visit this year and it really is the easiest and best metro system have ever used. Fast efficient and fairly cheap, miles better than its London, New York or Berlin alternatives as have used them all. The navigo card is brilliant

reviews.title: About what you'd expect
reviews.review_text:
The paper tickets are tiny and stop working after like a day, no matter if it's meant to last a few days. Something to do with the magnetic strip if it touches your phone or if it gets bent so on. plus how can you keep track of a peice of paper that small for a few days. It's about 2cm high and 5cm wide. I wasted like ‚Ç¨20  because the ticket cost ‚Ç¨35 to begin with, that was meant to last 72 hours stopped working in 24 hours.

The staff will refuse to speak english and make you buy a Navigo card and ignore the fact you paid for a ticket. The Navigo card is better.

Subway was frequent if not crowded, easy to navigate and get around.

reviews.title: We can‚Äôt sleep because of bad services.
reviews.review_text: Aircon is not working.  Telephone is not working. We spend two (2) nights without sleep because of a very hot room. We reported the issue on the receptionist twice.  They just promised to fix it never done anything. Me and my wife are very frustrated.  We don‚Äôt recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel, very  professional personal, very well placed, nearby everything, I‚Äôll come back for sure!!!
reviews.review_text: Excellent, specially personal of the Hotel, particularly Paulo such a nice man, continuously worry about any need that we have, he helped us in many ways. Hope in my next visit all the amenities are set, like restaurant, the entrance, breakfast used to be better when I visited it in 2022, best regards to all the personal they‚Äôre the best!

reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Paris
reviews.review_text: My favorite hotel in the heart of my favorite district of Paris! Convenient location (close to train, shopping, restaurants) yet quiet and charming. Breakfast was lovely, well stocked in-room coffee/tea, friendly staff, very clean hotel that is well maintained (elevators fast!)

reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff but currently baorded up as being renovated.
reviews.review_text: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a month long trip. Great location and as per other reviews the staff are very friendly and helpful. However, we were unaware that the hotel is currently being renovated. The front is all boarded up and the outdoor courtyard is not available. As a result there is no natural light coming into the hotel. When we arrived security had to come out and get us as they obviously saw we could not find the entrance. We didn't enjoy our stay as it felt dark and pokey.

reviews.title: Very nice experience in paris
reviews.review_text: Paulo one of the best employees of the Novotel hotel, very servicial and kind. He help us too much in our time in paris. He told and explain many things to do in paris and places to know, he recommend many restaurants and was very good. He help us to do our visit was very easy.

Bustronome Paris.description: Aboard a double-decker bus converted into a restaurant, guests will enjoy a friendly welcome and a wide variety of dishes in a fashionable setting. The BUSTRONOME : a Parisian invitation to rediscover some of the City of Light's most beautiful locations while enjoying fine French cuisine. This singular journey combines a visual experience with a treat for the taste buds; Paris residents and tourists alike can indulge their love of culture while savouring good food.

reviews.title: Amazing experience with fabulous food!
reviews.review_text: Loved this experience, we would highly recommend, food was of amazing standard considering it was made in a small bus kitchen.  Staff were friendly and helpful, sights were great and loved the extra stop by the Eiffel Tower.  There was a five course meal served with wine which included tuna, fish, beef, cheese and desert.  Tips: book in advance especially in busy times, you might need to request a non alcoholic or soft drink (outside of water) as these are not always served as standard, if you run out of wine we were able to request more, staying on after the small break stop is a must because this is when you will get the Eiffel Tower experience.

reviews.title: Sights of Paris and Dinner
reviews.review_text: Fabian and Lea our servers were spectacular. The whole idea of eating and seeing all the sites is just cool. The food was really good. A full 6 courses. They were also very accommodating to my dietary requirements. A wonderful experience.

reviews.title: Not worth the price
reviews.review_text: I booked this experience based upon the Frenchies YouTube review as they stated how great the food was and a lovely experience. The poached egg starter and strawberry dessert were good but everything in between was not that great, especially the fish and duck. The duck was overcooked and the fish wasn‚Äôt seasoned well. I had just left the Loire Valley and ate at some amazing restaurants and this just didn‚Äôt even compare. The wine was also poor. There was a couple seated behind us and I heard the gentleman telling the wait staff that the only good thing was the bread and he told them he didn‚Äôt even want the duck brought to the table because the food had been so poor. It is a very jerky experience and I gave up trying to figure out what I was looking at, as my information wasn‚Äôt loading. This was a very overpriced, underwhelming experience and I wouldn‚Äôt repeat it. It was extremely disappointing to stop at Invalides for pictures, instead of outside the Eiffel Tower.

reviews.title: Paris looks magical from the bus at night
reviews.review_text: great service, great experience, dinner exceeded all expectations, 6 courses of dinner, each one was very tasty.I will visit again.

reviews.title: Fabulous experience
reviews.review_text:
Amazing experience, especially following the Olympic Games

Staff were delightful, food was delicious 

We had a fabulous time, highly recommend

Generator Paris.address: 9-11 Place du Colonel Fabien, 75010 Paris France
Generator Paris.description: Generator Paris is a design-led hotel, offering both private and shared accommodations, located in the lively 10th district in Paris. Free WiFi access is available and it features a stylish lounge area with a games room. You can enjoy locally inspired dishes at the on-site Caf√© Fabien and listen to DJ music while having a drink from the basement bar. Each of the contemporary rooms here provides air conditioning, bed linen, and a private bathroom with a shower. Some private twin rooms also offer a private terrace. A continental breakfast is prepared every morning, you will also find a 24-hour front desk, a laundry room, and a rooftop terrace as well as the shared lounge area.

reviews.title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
reviews.review_text:
SO many things wrong with this hostel. First, the staff were all so unfriendly, condescending, aggressive and SO rude. Secondly, the rooms were MANKY. There were stains ALL OVER our sheets, gum on the bed frames, nails on the floor and hair all under the pillows. The bathrooms were full of mold and again hair. The rooms were SO hot and humid ALL THE TIME and the AC wouldn‚Äôt work and the windows won‚Äôt open fully. 
Thirdly, the beds were incredibly uncomfortable and the pillows didn‚Äôt support our necks at all - we all woke up with sore necks and backs the next morning with barely any sleep. 
Fourthly, everything was VERY overpriced- 3‚Ç¨ for 500ml of water?? MAD. And 7.50‚Ç¨ to rent a towel?? HELLO??? 
I could name incidents that occurred when I stayed but I feel I could get into trouble if I mention them. But AVOID THIS HOSTEL AT ALL COST!!

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.review_text: We organized a quick visit to Paris with friends with children in tow. We found a structure with welcoming staff, with the reception always open and available to answer requests. The stay met expectations, the rooms are functional and clean. No annoying noises. I recommend booking at Generator Paris

reviews.title: Single Woman - One Week in Mixed Dorm (6 Bed)
reviews.review_text:
Generally it's a fine place to stay if you need a place for a few nights - but what I didn't see in other reviews is that the bathrooms weren't terribly clean (tho the bedrooms were fine, cleanliness wise). And the price was pretty good but the location isn't so great. To be polite, it's not in a great area, so usually when I got up for the day I would immediately take the metro and head towards more central Paris to find a cafe or something. (Though the metro is extremely close so that was nice!) They do have luggage storage you can pay for, but it's easier to just keep it in your room (in my opinion). And I had 2 giant pieces of luggages which I was able to just put in the corner of the room and had no issues. (And then I put my backpack and whatnot in the storage under the bed.) 

The room was clean but just seemed like it wasn't super well maintained. I only say that because it seemed the window was broken and there was a temporary sign saying not to open it. (So the room would sometimes get a little stuffy/warm since we couldn't let any fresh air in.) And the hinges on my storage container under the bed were broken. Minor things of course, but worth mentioning. 

I had great experiences with the people I had in my room, they were all very friendly and I even spent a couple days walking around Paris with a couple of them! No issues at all with it being a mixed dorm. (I liked to refer to them as my "temporary friends" bc we would chat and hang out in Paris for a few days and then one of us would check out of the hostel and have to say goodbye lol.) 

And the staff were very lovely and helpful and are happy to help in English or French.

Overall I had a pleasant stay, but I just wanted to be honest about some of the negative points that I didn't see in other reviews before I booked.

reviews.title: Cost-aware Business Trip
reviews.review_text: Positive experience on a last-minute business trip...wish the architect and lighting designer had been less excited by the word generator and more excited about contributing to Paris.

reviews.title: Top place
